text.content:
Some archetypes have the multiclass trait. These allow you to diversify your training into another class's specialties. You can't select a multiclass archetype's dedication feat if you are already a member of that class.

Source: Pathfinder Player Core pg. 215

You have embarked upon a path of great sacrifice and oaths, granting you the power to wield the light as you see fit.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e-adventures-in-etheirys.feats.Item.BJsXCfHbmT9E4n4S]{Paladin Dedication} Feat 2

  • archetype
  • dedication
  • multiclass

Prerequisites Strength +2, Charisma +2

Choose a teaching from the paladin class. You become trained in your teaching's associated skill; if you were already trained in this skill, you instead become trained in a skill of your choice.

You become trained in paladin class DC. If you later gain a holy spell, you become trained in spell attack modifier and spell DC.

You become trained in light armor and medium armor. If you already were trained in light armor and medium armor, you gain training in heavy armor as well. Whenever you gain a class feature that grants you expert or greater proficiency in any type of armor (but not unarmored defense), you also gain that proficiency in the armor types granted to you by this feat. If you have a class feature that grants you expert proficiency in unarmored defense and you’re 13th level or higher, you also become an expert in the armor types granted to you by this feat.

You gain the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e-adventures-in-etheirys.actions.Item.zhNSaLTFP5jqE6Lq]{Iron Will} action

Source: Adventures in Etheirys

You have spent time learning the art of wielding swords, improving your skills in such weapons and wearing armor. You have acquired certain credentials and a strict code of conduct. With further training, you can acquire unique skills in close combat.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e-adventures-in-etheirys.feats.Item.qHrsnPNC9Z2ynNcV]{Samurai Dedication} Feat 2

  • archetype
  • dedication
  • multiclass

Prerequisites Strength +2, Dexterity +2

You become trained in Samurai Weapons, as well as in your choice of Acrobatics or Athletics and Society. If you are already trained in any of these skills, you become trained in another skill of your choice for each of the skills you cannot take.

You become trained in light and medium armor, as well as Samurai class DC. Choose a Samurai Form. You may take Samurai feats of that form, but you do not gain that form's benefits.

Source: Adventures in Etheirys

You've learned the mixture of engineering and artifice needed to take up the mantle of the Engineer, whether that be through the development of powerful armor, a uniquely potent multi-tool, a magitek pawn, or the fabled magitek mechs.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e-adventures-in-etheirys.feats.Item.giT72uZSa9XR0n2U]{Engineer Dedication} Feat 2

  • archetype
  • dedication
  • multiclass

Prerequisites Intelligence +3

You become trained in Crafting and engineer class DC. You proficiency rank in engineer's multi-tools increases to trained, and can create your own, but you only have 4 TP to create one with, instead of the normal 6 TP of an engineer (and it only counts as a martial weapon, only granting an additional 2 TP). Additionally, you can't later modify your multi-tool to remove traits and regain TP, or otherwise rearrange your tool, unlike a normal engineer.

Source: Adventures in Etheirys

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e-adventures-in-etheirys.feats.Item.64pguvZ1qrRAcr19]{Multi-Tool Expertise} Feat 12

  • archetype

@Embed[Compendium.pf2e-adventures-in-etheirys.feats.Item.64pguvZ1qrRAcr19 inline]

Source: Adventures in Etheirys
You choose a class archetype at level 1 and must choose its dedication feat as your 2nd level class feat. You can never have more than one class archetype.

• Uncommon

Many engineers espouse the ideology that versatility is king, and that the best approach to engineering is to spread your focus and be able to do many things at once, but there exists many that disagree, and few are more… outspoken than those who truly devote their all to the lifestyle of the Magitek Mech.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e-adventures-in-etheirys.class-features.Item.7bAg41CdNqBJzdWk]{Magitek Mechtech}

Your knowledge over magitek mechs is truly staggering, and it reflects in how extreme your focus is on them, and this makes you a Magitek Pilot. You must select the Magitek Pilot Dedication as your 2nd-level class feat.

Prerequisites:

  • You must be an Engineer
  • You don't gain the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e-adventures-in-etheirys.class-features.Item.pFLvfhjfYRqBeN7m]{Engineer's Pinnacle Invention} class feature.
  • You cannot qualify for the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.Item.AmP0qu7c5dlBSath]{Toughness} general feat, nor can you take any feat like it that grants you improved Hit Points.

Class HP: Your class HP is reduced to 4 instead of 8.

Magitek Pilot Adjustments: You become untrained in medium armor, and you can only spend 4 Tool Points on your engineer's multi-tool. You don't choose a major engineering invention, instead gaining the Magitek Mech invention, which gives you a magitek mech.

Your mech is empowered with the benefits below, and you can choose for one of its weapons (but not your multi-tool) to count as a Skysteel Multi-Tool, or for its frame to count as Magitek Armor. Whatever you choose, the mech can access initial modifications for that invention in addition to its own.

Foundry note This part cannot be automated, you can pick the secondary invention but the features have to be manually altered.

Magitek Mech Adjustments: Your magitek mech is far more durable, regardless of when it is online or inactive. While inactive, your mech gains additional Hit Points equal to 8 + your Intelligence modifier instead of 6. While online and when you are Piloting your mech, you add your mech's Hit Points to your own, though you only add half your Intelligence modifier. This functionally grants you 12 + your Constitution modifier + half of your Intelligence modifier in HP.

Engineering Weapon Expertise & Mastery Adjustments: Instead of gaining these two class features, you instead gain Mechtech Expertise and Mechtech Mastery, which are the same, but improve your mech's Intelligence modifier substitution features.

Finally, at 19th level, you gain the Pinnacle Mechtech feature: Your mech is a truly incredible piece of engineering, far superior to any mech used by your peers. You gain an additional modification for your magitek mech, which can be any magitek mech modification, or any initial or breakthrough modification of the other inventions your mech incorporates (the option you chose at level 1, and any others gained through feats).

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e-adventures-in-etheirys.feats.Item.WCXIzPDgtmcQIFEM]{Magitek Pilot Dedication} Feat 2

  • uncommon
  • archetype
  • dedication
  • engineer

Prerequisites You are an Engineer

You excel behind the controls of your mech. Your mech's Hit Points while inactive are doubled, and you gain an additional modification for your mech, chosen from your magitek mech initial modifications, or from the initial modifications of the invention you chose to have part of your mech count as.

Source: Adventures in Etheirys

You’ve picked up a knack for crafting and an appreciation for the land and its materials.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e-adventures-in-etheirys.feats.Item.ouaf04fm420lNjfq]{Disciple Dedication} Feat 2

  • archetype
  • dedication
  • multiclass

Prerequisites Strength or Dexterity +2, Intelligence +2

You cast spells like a disciple, gaining a spellbook with four common arcanima cantrips of your choice. You gain the Cast a Spell activity. You can prepare two cantrips each day from your spellbook. Each time you gain a spell slot of a new level from the disciple archetype, add a spell of that level or lower to your spellbook. You're trained in arcanima spell attack rolls and spell DCs. Your key spellcasting ability for disciple archetype spells is Intelligence, and they are arcanima disciple spells.

You become trained in your choice of Arcana or Crafting; if you were already trained in both of these skills, you instead become trained in a skill of your choice. You also gain the gift of the land disciple class feature, except you do not gain the saving throws.

Source: Adventures in Etheirys
